result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary Steven Waters was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Zachary Steven Waters
Current: 571 Cty Rd A, c/o Green Lake County Jail, Green Lake, WI 54941 United States  (Effective: 10-24-2016)
Prior: 233 Koro Rd, Ripon, WI 54971

2:50 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Joey Roeth.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - count 1 will be amended to Misdemeanor Possession of THC and a count 2 will be added for Misdemeanor Possess Drug Paraphernalia, with jail, costs, DNA sample and fine and costs.  State concurs.  Atty Roeth concurs, also $200 restitution for buy money.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on the amended charge and poss drug parpahernalia.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Roeth.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

COUNT 1 (Misd Poss THC)

-90 days county jail, with huber and to commence within 60 days.  Court grants out of county service and out of county travel.
-Court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan. 
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

COUNT 2 (Poss drug para)

-$100 fine plus court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
-Defendant is to submit a DNA Sample.

Restitution of $200.00

Court adjourned at 2:59 p.m.
Status hearing on October 11, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

2:48 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Joey Roeth.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Roeth - no agreement at this time and hope to resolve.  Court sets for Status Hearing on October 11, 2016 at 2:00 p.m. 

Court adjourned at 2:49 p.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 30, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

11:17 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Barb Privat present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - spoke with the defendant, he is not able to get the information as requested and just need another date.  Court sets for plea & sentencing on July 19, 2016 at 10:30 a.m.  Mandatory appearance.

Court adjourned at 11:17 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 31, 2016 at 11:30 am.

10:49 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - received an offer last yesterday and didn't get a chance to discuss with the defendant and requests a short recess so offer can be discussed.

Court recess at 10:51 .m.

Court reconvenes at 10:58 a.m.  Same appearances.  Statement by Atty Privat - discussed offer with the defendant and Defendant is getting her more information and just requests another date.  Court sets for plea & sentencing on May 31, 2016 at 11:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 10:59 a.m.
State's
For Discovery - Defendant's
Status hearing on May 3, 2016 at 10:30 am.

11:01 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - defendant will waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant concurs.  Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Privat and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Privat enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant. Court sets for Status Hearing on May 3, 2016 at 10:30 a.m.  

Court adjourned at 11:03 a.m.

10:13 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant - plans on getting an attorney, applied with the PD's office.  Statement by the court - informs the defendant that if denied by the PD's office, will need to contact 2 attorneys before applying to the court.  Court sets for Status Hearing on Febraury 9, 2016 at 9:15 a.m.

Court adjourned at 10:15 a.m.
Status hearing at 01-11-2016 09:30 am

9:03 a.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs defendant of his/her right to an attorney.  Court notes bond has been set.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will set for Status Hearing on January 11, 2016 at 9:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 9:06 a.m.

Original warrant has been received and destroyed.

Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail and without counsel.

1:22 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake County Jail and without counsel.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received a copy of the criminal complaint.  Court goes over charges.  Court questions defendant regarding address and employment.  ADA makes bond recommendation.  Court orders bond set at $1,000.00 signature bond.  Defendant to return to court on December 22, 2015 at 8:30 a.m. for Initial Apeparance.

Court adjourned at 1:24 p.m.
